Wesley_Dennis_(singer):
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Use mdy dates|date=September 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Wesley Dennis | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = | birth_place = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1963|04|22}}{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2008|publisher=Record Research, Inc.|date=August 2008|pages=122|isbn=978-0-89820-177-2}} | origin = [[Clanton, Alabama]], United States | instrument = Vocals | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 1995-2002, 2012–present | label = [[Mercury Nashville]]
Dirt Road | associated_acts = [[Keith Stegall]] | website = }} '''Wesley Dennis''' (born April 22, 1963, in [[Clanton, Alabama]]) is an American [[country music]] artist. A native of [[Alabama]], Dennis previously held a job installing car windshields before he took to singing in bars.{{cite news |author=No byline |title=Up and country: Wesley Dennis used to install car windshields. Now he's looking at life just a little bit differently |url=http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=SB&p_theme=sb&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&p_topdoc=1&p_text_direct-0=0EB0DB21A8296F7B&p_field_direct-0=document_id&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&s_trackval=GooglePM |work=[[The Sacramento Bee]] |pages=C1 |date=March 2, 1995|accessdate=August 27, 2008}} In 1995, he signed to [[Mercury Nashville Records]], releasing a self-titled debut album, and charting three singles on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs]] charts. He also toured with [[Alan Jackson]] that same year. Dennis's debut album was produced by [[Keith Stegall]], who has also produced for Jackson, and was released on March 7, 1995, to mostly favorable reviews. ''New Country'' magazine critic Chris Dickinson gave it three-and-a-half stars out of five, calling him "as honestly neo-trad as they come", although he said that the tracks "This Hat Ain't No Act" and "Bubbaland" were "dime-a-gross."{{cite journal|last=Dickinson|first=Chris|date=March 1995|title=Music reviews|journal=New Country|volume=2|issue=3|pages=61}} ''[[USA Today]]'' also gave a favorable review, comparing Dennis' vocals to those of [[Keith Whitley]], but criticizing "This Hat Ain't No Act" as a "trite" song.{{cite news|url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/USAToday/access/19341859.html?dids=19341859:19341859&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Apr+03%2C+1995&author=Edna+Gundersen%3B+David+Zimmerman%3B+James+T.+Jones+IV%3B+David+Patrick+Stearns&pub=USA+TODAY+%28pre-1997+Fulltext%29&desc=A+knockout+from+Morphine&pqatl=google|title=A knockout from Morphine|date=April 3, 1995|work=USA Today|pages=D4|accessdate=September 13, 2009|first=Edna|last=Gundersen|archive-date=October 22, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121022141926/http://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/USAToday/access/19341859.html?dids=19341859:19341859&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Apr+03,+1995&author=Edna+Gundersen;+David+Zimmerman;+James+T.+Jones+IV;+David+Patrick+Stearns&pub=USA+TODAY+(pre-1997+Fulltext)&desc=A+knockout+from+Morphine&pqatl=google|url-status=dead}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- !
